newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah soft in slow late trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah soft in slow late trading.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was soft against the dollar in slow late trading on Friday as liquidity remained largely sufficient, dealers said.
One Japanese bank dealer said the weak rupiah was also partly due to a stronger dollar against the yen, but added that weekly corporate tax payments helped limit the rupiah's fall.
"The rupiah had weakened in the face of the stronger dollar against the Japenese yen, but the weekly corporate payments capped the rupiah's fall," the Japanese bank dealer.
Dealers said liquidity was likely to tighten next week as banks were likely to do window-dressing ahead of the half-year book closing.
Spot rupiah was at 2,431.00/31.40 at 1010 GMT against an opening of 2,430.00/30.75.
Tomorrow and today rupiah were at 2,430.80/31.10 and 2,430.25/30.75, respectively.
One local bank dealer said the spot rupiah rate was likely to range between 2,429.50 to 2,430.50 on Monday.
The central bank, Bank Indonesia, kept its intervention band at 2,425/2,617 and its conversion band at 2,425/2,473 on Friday.
Overnight swap was last at 0.45/0.55 while tom/next was at 0.25/0.30 points.
One-month swaps were at 13.50/14.25, two at 28.00/29.00, three at 41.50/43.00 and six at 85.50/86.50 points.
